intro: Allium elwesii, commonly known as the Elwes leek, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe. It features grass-like basal leaves and produces umbels of pale to deep purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Allium elwesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
